poem:
B-list Leaders

In the garden  
of public trust,  
they bloom briefly—  
like brittle flowers  
caught in the wind  
of ambition's chill,  
petals falling  
before the harvest.  
Spectacle without root,  
names on a screen,  
fading faster  
than morning dew  
on grass that  
bends and breaks  
beneath  
our troubled strides.
